cs.SD, cs.CL, cs.SD, cs.LG, cs.SI. 

The paper is about statistical parametric speech synthesis (SPSS), which involves modeling speech signals using statistical methods. This falls under the sub-category of natural language processing (NLP) and speech processing (SP) in computer science. Specifically, the paper proposes a new framework for representing speech waveforms and modeling them jointly with magnitude and phase spectra. This involves techniques from signal processing, machine learning, and optimization. Therefore, the most likely sub-categories are cs.SD (sound), cs.CL (computation and language), and cs.LG (machine learning). Additionally, the paper evaluates the proposed framework using objective evaluation metrics, which involves statistical analysis and experimental design. This suggests the sub-categories of cs.SI (social and information networks) and cs.DS (data structures and algorithms) as possible choices.
